newsitem.title: JAPAN: OSE permits firms' option trade without membership.
newsitem.headline: OSE permits firms' option trade without membership.

text.p: The Osaka Securities Exchange (OSE) said on Thursday that it would allow three securities houses to trade individual stock options without OSE membership.

The three firms are Shinwa Securities Co, Bear Stearns Japan Ltd, and Lehman Brothers Japan Inc. The right is limited to trading of individual equity options, not other stock options, the exchange said.
The Tokyo and Osaka bourses will start trading individual stock options on July 18, as part of a drive to free up Japan's financial market and catch up with other global financial centres.
